title: Unauthorized Access to Information System or Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention gains unauthorized access to any information system or data shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years or with a fine up to one million rupees or both.

title: Unauthorized Copying or Transmission of Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention and without authorization copies or transmits any data shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months or with a fine up to one hundred thousand rupees or both.

title: Interference with Information System or Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention interferes with or damages any part or whole of an information system or data shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or with a fine up to five hundred thousand rupees or both.

title: Unauthorized Access to Critical Infrastructure Information System or Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention gains unauthorized access to any critical infrastructure information system or data shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years or with a fine up to five million rupees or both.

article: Unauthorized Copying of Critical Infrastructure Data
title: Unauthorized Copying or Transmission of Critical Infrastructure Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention and without authorization copies or transmits any critical infrastructure data shall be punished with imprisonment up to five years or with a fine up to five million rupees or both.

title: Interference with Critical Infrastructure Information System or Data
description: Whoever with dishonest intention interferes with or damages any part or whole of a critical infrastructure information system or data shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years or with a fine up to ten million rupees or both.

title: Glorification of an Offence
description: Whoever prepares or disseminates information that glorifies an offence or the person accused or convicted of a crime shall be punished with imprisonment up to seven years or with a fine or both.

title: Cyber Terrorism
description: Whoever commits or threatens to commit any offence with the intent to coerce, intimidate, or create a sense of fear in the government or public shall be punished with imprisonment up to fourteen years or with a fine up to fifty million rupees or both.

title: Electronic Forgery
description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly makes, generates, or issues an electronic document with the intent to deceive shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years or with a fine up to two hundred fifty thousand rupees or both.

title: Electronic Fraud
description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly gains unauthorized access to any information system or data with the intent to obtain an economic benefit shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years or with a fine up to ten million rupees or both.

Whoever, by deceitful or illegal means, deprives a woman of her inheritance rights shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years but shall not be less than five years and with a fine of one million rupees.

law_name: Protection Against Harassment of Women at the Workplace Act, 2010
description: Any person who commits an act of harassment against a woman at the workplace shall be liable to disciplinary action, including a fine or termination of employment, as prescribed under the law.

law_name: Acid Control and Acid Crime Prevention Act, 2011
description: Whoever causes hurt by means of a corrosive substance shall be punished with imprisonment for life or imprisonment of either description which shall not be less than fourteen years and a fine which may not be less than one million rupees.
Whoever commits an act of domestic violence shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years or with a fine which may extend to one hundred thousand rupees or with both.

A man is said to commit rape if he penetrates the vagina, anus, or urethra of a woman with any part of his body or with any object without her consent. The offense is punishable with death or imprisonment for a term not less than ten years.

law_name: Criminal Law (Amendment) (Offenses in the Name or Pretext of Honour) Act, 2016
description: Whoever commits an offense in the name or on the pretext of honour shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, notwithstanding any compromise or pardon.
Harassment of transgender persons, both within and outside the home, is prohibited and shall be punishable according to the provisions of this Act.

law_name: The Zainab Alert, Response and Recovery Act, 2020
article: Zainab Alert, Response and Recovery Agency (ZARRA)
description: Establishes ZARRA to issue alerts for missing children and ensure their swift recovery. The agency coordinates with various stakeholders to protect children from abduction and exploitation.

article: Prohibition of Death Penalty for Juveniles
description: Ensures that any individual under the age of 18 at the time of the commission of an offense shall not be sentenced to death, promoting rehabilitation and reintegration into society.

law_name: The National Commission on the Rights of Child Act, 2017
description: Empowers the commission to examine and review laws related to child rights, propose new legislation, and ensure the effective implementation of measures for child protection.

law_name: The Islamabad Capital Territory Child Protection Act, 2018
description: Mandates the establishment of child protection institutions to provide shelter, care, and rehabilitation to children in need, including those subjected to abuse, exploitation, or neglect.
Prohibits the employment of children below the age of 14 in certain hazardous occupations and regulates the working conditions of adolescents to prevent exploitation and abuse.

article: Punishment for Male Adult Marrying a Child
description: Prescribes penalties for adult males above 18 years who contract a marriage with a child below the specified age, aiming to prevent child marriages and protect children's rights.

law_name: The Prevention of Trafficking in Persons Act, 2018
description: Criminalizes the act of recruiting, transporting, transferring, harboring, or receiving individuals, especially children, through coercion, abduction, fraud, or deception for exploitation purposes.
Addresses the offense of exposing children to obscene and sexually explicit material, prescribing imprisonment and fines to protect children's moral and psychological well-being.
Whoever commits an act of domestic violence shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years or with a fine which may extend to one hundred thousand rupees or with both.

law_name: Punjab Protection of Women Against Violence Act, 2016
description: The court may issue a protection order to prevent the respondent from committing any act of violence against the aggrieved person, prohibiting communication, and ensuring the safety of the aggrieved person.

law_name: Sindh Domestic Violence (Prevention and Protection) Act, 2013
description: The government shall establish Protection Committees at the district level to monitor the implementation of the Act and assist victims of domestic violence.

law_name: Balochistan Domestic Violence (Prevention and Protection) Act, 2014
description: The government shall appoint Protection Officers to assist the court in the discharge of its functions and to ensure the safety of the aggrieved person.

law_name: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Domestic Violence Against Women (Prevention and Protection) Act, 2021
description: The government shall establish shelter homes for the aggrieved persons to provide them with temporary residence and necessary facilities.
